title: Love Island’s India and Ovie avoid run-in at Pride of Britain Awards
text:
India and Ovie are moving on (Picture: WireImage, Splash News)

Love Island stars India Reynolds and Ovie Soko appear to have avoided an awkward run-in at the Pride of Britain Awards last night, just days after their shock split was revealed.

The ITV2 reality stars attended the prestigious awards at London’s Grosvenor House hotel on Monday evening. While they both run in the same circles, they at least managed to escape bumping into each other on the red carpet.

Ovie, 28, rocked up to the awards ceremony looking dapper in a navy suit and white shirt, and was spotted taking time to sign autographs for fans. But once inside, he reunited with his best Love Island pal Amber Gill, whom he sat with for the show.

The besties were back to their usual antics of joking around with each other, and larked around in Amber’s Instagram Stories. Coincidentally, India also spent time with Amber after they presented the young achiever award to Hezron Brown, a reformed gang member.

India, also 28, looked stunning on the red carpet in a burgundy off-the-shoulder gown and seemed to be in good spirits while posing for photos.

The lingerie model publicly confirmed the split for the first time while speaking to the Mail Online on the red carpet.

‘Obviously it’s difficult, but any break-up is difficult,’ she admitted. ‘It’s even more difficult when it’s in front of the rest of the world, but I’ll be fine.’

India admits break-ups are difficult (Picture: WireImage)

‘I’m lucky I’ve got a really close group of girlfriends, they’ve been really looking after me.’

When asked if guys had been sliding into her DMs now that she’s single again, India laughed: ‘Maybe they’ll be a bit more full now!’

Although she did admit being single again feels strange, joking: ‘I feel like I’ve been dropped back in the ocean. We’ll see.’

Ovie was in good spirits (Picture: Splash News)

Ovie and India struck up a romance this summer after meeting on Love Island and made it to the final, finishing in third place.

However, reports that their relationship was on the rocks emerged earlier this month with an insider revealing they were having ‘crisis talks’. It had been more than a month since they were seen together and sources say they were struggling to spend time together due to their busy work schedules.

India hinted that she was receiving negative messages online as she posted on Instagram hours after the split: ‘It’s free to be kind… Think before you type… Thank you x.’

Ovie seems to be in high spirits as he shared an uplifting message for his fans after hitting the gym on Sunday.

‘On this beautiful Sunday you should all remember: “Shine bright like a diamond.” Because Rihanna said so,’ he said in the video which he captioned: ‘Post gym energy.’
